body_html:
PyTorch generally takes care of all the CPU-GPU synchronization, and will insert it in certain points when it's needed. Because of that we don't need any way of querying whether the data is ready or not. How is your debugger printing the tensors? Is it just calling __str__?

I'm not aware of any other debuggers that would have this issue.
body_text:
PyTorch generally takes care of all the CPU-GPU synchronization, and will insert it in certain points when it's needed. Because of that we don't need any way of querying whether the data is ready or not. How is your debugger printing the tensors? Is it just calling __str__?
I'm not aware of any other debuggers that would have this issue.
body:
PyTorch generally takes care of all the CPU-GPU synchronization, and will insert it in certain points when it's needed. Because of that we don't need any way of querying whether the data is ready or not. How is your debugger printing the tensors? Is it just calling `__str__`?

I'm not aware of any other debuggers that would have this issue.
